text: I am in need of music that would flow%% Over my fretful, feeling finger-tips,
Over my fretful, feeling finger-tips, Over my bitter-tainted, trembling lips,
Over my bitter-tainted, trembling lips, With melody, deep, clear, and liquid-slow.
With melody, deep, clear, and liquid-slow. Oh, for the healing swaying, old and low,
Oh, for the healing swaying, old and low, Of some song sung to rest the tired dead,
Of some song sung to rest the tired dead, A song to fall like water on my head,
A song to fall like water on my head, And over quivering limbs, dream flushed to glow!
And over quivering limbs, dream flushed to glow! There is a magic made by melody:
There is a magic made by melody: A spell of rest, and quiet breath, and cool
A spell of rest, and quiet breath, and cool%% Heart, that sinks through fading colors deep
Heart, that sinks through fading colors deep%% To the subaqueous stillness of the sea,
To the subaqueous stillness of the sea, And floats forever in a moon-green pool,
And floats forever in a moon-green pool, Held in the arms of rhythm and of sleep.
